thread.title: LA WFO SHREVEPORT Warnings, Watches, and Advisories
thread.title_full: LA WFO SHREVEPORT Warnings, Watches, and Advisories

author: Accuweather
title: LA WFO SHREVEPORT Warnings, Watches, and Advisories
text:
WFO SHREVEPORT Warnings, Watches and Advisories for Monday, March 25, 2024
FLOOD WARNING
Flood Statement
National Weather Service Shreveport LA
1015 PM CDT Thu Mar 21 2024
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in
Louisiana...
Bayou Dorcheat At Dixie Inn affecting Webster, Bienville and
Bossier Parishes.
For the Bayou Dorcheat...including Springhill, Dixie Inn, Lake
Bistineau...Minor flooding is forecast.
PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...
People are also readingâ€¦
Do not drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website
address into your favorite web browser URL bar:
The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1015 AM CDT.
...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY AFTERNOON...
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Bayou Dorcheat at Dixie Inn.
* WHEN...Until Monday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Lowland flooding will continue for several
more days. The bayou will continue to slowly fall and flood
problems will decrease and end.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 10:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 17.1 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 10:00 PM CDT Thursday was 18.7 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
late Sunday evening and continue falling to 12.8 feet Tuesday
evening.
- Flood stage is 14.0 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
16.9 feet on 05/07/2016.
...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE...
* WHERE...Bayou Dorcheat at Lake Bistineau.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 143.0 feet, Water begins to flow over Louisiana 164.
- At 9:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 143.1 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 141.0 feet.
ending at 9:00 PM CDT Thursday was 143.1 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 143.5
feet tomorrow evening.
- Flood stage is 142.5 feet.
143.5 feet on 01/03/1983.
* WHERE...Bayou Dorcheat near Springhill.
* IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding of private boat
ramps. Move livestock to higher ground.
- At 10:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 13.2 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet.
ending at 10:00 PM CDT Thursday was 13.7 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 11.5 feet Tuesday
- Flood stage is 11.0 feet.
13.2 feet on 04/05/2016.
